posts.description: A web app that works out how many seconds ago something happened. How hard can coding that be? Tom Scott explains how time twists and turns like a twisty-tur...

posts.message:
Very important Notice,

Please guys give more attention to our group policy and your target audience. We are not html5 beginners and we don't want to know how to clean our RAM. Think twice before you share something and before you add your post in your group and ask your self. is this something that will really make people open their mouth when they see it? if the answer is yes then go a head and show us your power.

We look for Quality and not Quantity. we don't want to end up as any random group for sharing links as this is not our target.

We are here to share our knowledge with you, give you the best answers to your questions and to keep our community a luxury community for the top Geeks in Egypt.

Thanks to all of you who keep up with our policies.
Mohamed

I'm looking to contribute to an opensource project in my spare time. I guess it would be useful if those who contributed before could share their experience with us :)
posts.caption: blog.smartbear.com
posts.description: Plenty of people want to get involved in open source, but don’t know where to start. Here are several ways to help out even if you lack confidence in your technical chops.

posts.caption: tooling.github.io
posts.description: Over the past few years, there has been a new wave of highly compelling and immersive web applications. Some of them replacing native applications as they are on par (if not better) in terms of usability and features. To build and maintain such complex applications in a collaborative environment, it…

posts.caption: git-tower.com
posts.description: Aimed at the complete beginner, 'Learn Git' helps you get started with Git - the best version control system currently available. A free online book, videos, and ebooks get you off the ground as quickly as possible.
